question: Katerina Sakellaropoulou was recently elected as the first female President of which country?
explanation:
Katerina Sakellaropoulou was recently elected as the first female President of Greece. The Prime Minister of Greece, Kyriakos Mitsotakis nominated Katerina Sakellaropoulou as the President. The 63-year-old Sakellaropoulou has worked as a top-level judge in Greece.
The term of the current president of Greece, Prokopis Pavlopoulos is to expire in March, this year. The newly elected President is expected to hold the post for next five years. According to the Greek constitution, the President is the commander-in-chief of the country\'s armed forces and is often consulted on important national affairs.
